Carl Burton Stokes (June 21, 1927  April 3, 1996) was an American politician of 
the Democratic party who served as the 51st mayor of Cleveland, Ohio. Elected 
on November 7, 1967, and taking office on January 1, 1968, he was the first black 
elected mayor of a major U.S. city. ... Mayor of Cleveland. In office 19681971.
